mode=block</span><span class="pl-c1">Content-Length: 202</span><span class="pl-c1">Connection: keep-alive</span><span class="pl-c1">{</span><span class="pl-c1">  "args": {},</span><span class="pl-c1">  "headers": {</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Accept": "*/*",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Host": "httpbin.org",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0"</span><span class="pl-c1">  },</span><span class="pl-c1">  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",</span><span class="pl-c1">  "url": "https://httpbin.org/get"</span><span class="pl-c1">}</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">CacheByResponseType</h3><a id="user-content-cachebyresponsetype" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: CacheByResponseType" href="#cachebyresponsetype"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><code>CacheResponsesPlugin</code> plugin can also automatically cache responses by <code>content-type</code>.To try this, you must be running under <a href="#tls-interception">TLS Interception</a> modeand then pass <code>--cache-by-content-type</code> flag.  Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin \    --cache-by-content-type \    --ca-key-file ca-key.pem \    --ca-cert-file ca-cert.pem \    --ca-signing-key ca-signing-key.pem"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --cache-by-content-type \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-key-file ca-key.pem \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-cert-file ca-cert.pem \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-signing-key ca-signing-key.pem</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Make a few requests to the proxy server and you shall see data under <code>~/.proxy/cache</code> directory.</p><p dir="auto">You should see 2 folders:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>content</code>: Contains parsed <code>jpg</code>, <code>css</code>, <code>js</code>, <code>html</code>, <code>pdf</code> etc by content type</li><li><code>responses</code>: Contains raw responses as received <em>(of-course decrypted because of interception)</em></li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">ManInTheMiddlePlugin</h3><a id="user-content-maninthemiddleplugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ManInTheMiddlePlugin" href="#maninthemiddleplugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Modifies upstream server responses.</p><p dir="auto">Start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.ManInTheMiddlePlugin"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.ManInTheMiddlePlugin</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Verify using <code>curl -v -x localhost:8899 http://google.com</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="... [redacted] ...< HTTP/1.1 200 OK< Content-Length: 28<* Connection #0 to host localhost left intactHello from man in the middle"><pre><span class="pl-c1">... [redacted] ...</span><span class="pl-c1">< HTTP/1.1 200 OK</span><span class="pl-c1">< Content-Length: 28</span><span class="pl-c1"><</span><span class="pl-c1">* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact</span><span class="pl-c1">Hello from man in the middle</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Response body <code>Hello from man in the middle</code> is sent by our plugin.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">ProxyPoolPlugin</h3><a id="user-content-proxypoolplugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ProxyPoolPlugin" href="#proxypoolplugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Forward incoming proxy requests to a set of upstream proxy servers.</p><p dir="auto">Let's start 2 upstream proxies first.  To simulate upstream proxies,start <code>proxy.py</code> on port <code>9000</code> and <code>9001</code></p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy --port 9000"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy --port 9000</span></pre></div><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy --port 9001"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy --port 9001</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Now, start <code>proxy.py</code> with <code>ProxyPoolPlugin</code> (on default <code>8899</code> port),pointing to our upstream proxies at <code>9000</code> and <code>9001</code> port.</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.ProxyPoolPlugin \    --proxy-pool localhost:9000 \    --proxy-pool localhost:9001"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.ProxyPoolPlugin \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --proxy-pool localhost:9000 \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --proxy-pool localhost:9001</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Make a curl request via <code>8899</code> proxy:</p><p dir="auto"><code>curl -v -x localhost:8899 http://httpbin.org/get</code></p><p dir="auto">Verify that <code>8899</code> proxy forwards requests to upstream proxiesby checking respective logs.</p><p dir="auto">If an upstream proxy require credentials, pass them as arguments. Example:</p><p dir="auto"><code>--proxy-pool user:pass@upstream.proxy:port</code></p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">FilterByClientIpPlugin</h3><a id="user-content-filterbyclientipplugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: FilterByClientIpPlugin" href="#filterbyclientipplugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Reject traffic from specific IP addresses. By default thisplugin blocks traffic from <code>127.0.0.1</code> and <code>::1</code>.</p><p dir="auto">Start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.FilterByClientIpPlugin"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.FilterByClientIpPlugin</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Send a request using <code>curl -v -x localhost:8899 http://google.com</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="... [redacted] ...> Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive>< HTTP/1.1 418 I'm a tea pot< Connection: close<* Closing connection 0"><pre><span class="pl-c1">... [redacted] ...</span>> <span class="pl-s1">Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive</span>><span class="pl-c1">< HTTP/1.1 418 I'm a tea pot</span><span class="pl-c1">< Connection: close</span><span class="pl-c1"><</span><span class="pl-c1">* Closing connection 0</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Modify plugin to your taste e.g. Allow specific IP addresses only.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">ModifyChunkResponsePlugin</h3><a id="user-content-modifychunkresponseplugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ModifyChunkResponsePlugin" href="#modifychunkresponseplugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin demonstrate how to modify chunked encoded responses. In able to do so, this plugin uses <code>proxy.py</code> core to parse the chunked encoded response. Then we reconstruct the response using custom hard-coded chunks, ignoring original chunks received from upstream server.</p><p dir="auto">Start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.ModifyChunkResponsePlugin"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.ModifyChunkResponsePlugin</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Verify using <code>curl -v -x localhost:8899 http://httpbin.org/stream/5</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="... [redacted] ...modifychunkresponseplugin* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact* Closing connection 0"><pre><span class="pl-c1">... [redacted] ...</span><span class="pl-c1">modify</span><span class="pl-c1">chunk</span><span class="pl-c1">response</span><span class="pl-c1">plugin</span><span class="pl-c1">* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact</span><span class="pl-c1">* Closing connection 0</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Modify <code>ModifyChunkResponsePlugin</code> to your taste. Example, instead of sending hard-coded chunks, parse and modify the original <code>JSON</code> chunks received from the upstream server.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">CloudflareDnsResolverPlugin</h3><a id="user-content-cloudflarednsresolverplugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: CloudflareDnsResolverPlugin" href="#cloudflarednsresolverplugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin uses <code>Cloudflare</code> hosted <code>DNS-over-HTTPS</code> <a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/encrypted-dns/dns-over-https/make-api-requests/dns-json" rel="nofollow">API</a> (json).</p><p dir="auto"><code>DoH</code> mandates a HTTP2 compliant client. Unfortunately <code>proxy.py</code>does not provide that yet, so we use a dependency. Install it:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ pip install "httpx[http2]""><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">pip install <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>httpx[http2]<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Now start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.CloudflareDnsResolverPlugin"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.CloudflareDnsResolverPlugin</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">By default, <code>CloudflareDnsResolverPlugin</code> runs in <code>security</code> mode and provides malware protection.Use <code>--cloudflare-dns-mode family</code> to also enable adult content protection too.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">CustomDnsResolverPlugin</h3><a id="user-content-customdnsresolverplugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: CustomDnsResolverPlugin" href="#customdnsresolverplugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin demonstrate how to use a custom DNS resolution implementation with <code>proxy.py</code>.This example plugin currently uses Python's in-built resolution mechanism.  Customize codeto your taste.  Example, query your custom DNS server, implement <code>DoH</code> or other mechanisms.</p><p dir="auto">Start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.CustomDnsResolverPlugin"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.CustomDnsResolverPlugin</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">CustomNetworkInterface</h3><a id="user-content-customnetworkinterface" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: CustomNetworkInterface" href="#customnetworkinterface"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><code>HttpProxyBasePlugin.resolve_dns</code> callback can also be used to configure <code>network interface</code> which must be used as the <code>source_address</code> for connection to the upstream server.</p><p dir="auto">See <a href="https://github.com/abhinavsingh/proxy.py/issues/535#issuecomment-961510862" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/abhinavsingh/proxy.py/issues/535/hovercard">this thread</a>for more details.</p><p dir="auto">PS: There is no plugin named, but <a href="#customdnsresolverplugin">CustomDnsResolverPlugin</a>can be easily customized according to your needs.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">ProgramNamePlugin</h3><a id="user-content-programnameplugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ProgramNamePlugin" href="#programnameplugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Attempts to resolve program <code>(application)</code> name for proxy requests originating from the local machine.If identified, client IP in the access logs is replaced with program name.</p><p dir="auto">Start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.ProgramNamePlugin"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.ProgramNamePlugin</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Make a request using <code>curl</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ curl -v -x localhost:8899 https://httpbin.org/get"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">curl -v -x localhost:8899 https://httpbin.org/get</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You must see log lines like this:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="... [redacted] ... - [I] server.access_log:419 - curl:58096 - CONNECT httpbin.org:443 - 6010 bytes - 1824.62ms"><pre><span class="pl-c1">... class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Reverse Proxy Plugins</h2><a id="user-content-reverse-proxy-plugins" class="anchor-element" Reverse Proxy capabilities.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Reverse Proxy</h3><a id="user-content-reverse-proxy" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Reverse Proxy" href="#reverse-proxy"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy --enable-reverse-proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.ReverseProxyPlugin"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy --enable-reverse-proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.ReverseProxyPlugin</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">With default configuration, <code>ReverseProxyPlugin</code> plugin is equivalent tofollowing <code>Nginx</code> config:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="location /get {    proxy_pass http://httpbin.org/get}"><pre><span class="pl-c1">location /get {</span><span class="pl-c1">    proxy_pass http://httpbin.org/get</span><span class="pl-c1">}</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Verify using <code>curl -v localhost:8899/get</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{  "args": {},  "headers": {    "Accept": "*/*",    "Host": "localhost",    "User-Agent": "curl/7.64.1"  },  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",  "url": "https://localhost/get"}"><pre><span class="pl-c1">{</span><span class="pl-c1">  "args": {},</span><span class="pl-c1">  "headers": {</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Accept": "*/*",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Host": "localhost",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "User-Agent": "curl/7.64.1"</span><span class="pl-c1">  },</span><span class="pl-c1">  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",</span><span class="pl-c1">  "url": "https://localhost/get"</span><span class="pl-c1">}</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Plugin Ordering</h2><a id="user-content-plugin-ordering" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Plugin Ordering" href="#plugin-ordering"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">When using multiple plugins, depending upon plugin functionality,it might be worth considering the order in which plugins are passedon the command line.</p><p dir="auto">Plugins are called in the same order as they are passed. Example,say we are using both <code>FilterByUpstreamHostPlugin</code> and<code>RedirectToCustomServerPlugin</code>. Idea is to drop all incoming <code>http</code>requests for <code>facebook.com</code> and <code>www.facebook.com</code> and redirect other<code>http</code> requests to our inbuilt web server.</p><p dir="auto">Hence, in this scenario it is important to use<code>FilterByUpstreamHostPlugin</code> before <code>RedirectToCustomServerPlugin</code>.If we enable <code>RedirectToCustomServerPlugin</code> before <code>FilterByUpstreamHostPlugin</code>,<code>facebook</code> requests will also get redirected to inbuilt web server,instead of being dropped.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">End-to-End Encryption</h1><a id="user-content-end-to-end-encryption" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: End-to-End Encryption" href="#end-to-end-encryption"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, <code>proxy.py</code> uses <code>http</code> protocol for communication with clients e.g. <code>curl</code>, <code>browser</code>. For enabling end-to-end encrypting using <code>tls</code> / <code>https</code> first generate certificates. <strong>Checkout</strong> the repository and run:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="make https-certificates"><pre><span class="pl-c1">make https-certificates</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --cert-file https-cert.pem \    --key-file https-key.pem"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --cert-file https-cert.pem \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --key-file https-key.pem</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Verify using <code>curl -x https://localhost:8899 --proxy-cacert https-cert.pem https://httpbin.org/get</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{  "args": {},  "headers": {    "Accept": "*/*",    "Host": "httpbin.org",    "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0"  },  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",  "url": "https://httpbin.org/get"}"><pre><span class="pl-c1">{</span><span class="pl-c1">  "args": {},</span><span class="pl-c1">  "headers": {</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Accept": "*/*",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Host": "httpbin.org",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0"</span><span class="pl-c1">  },</span><span class="pl-c1">  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",</span><span class="pl-c1">  "url": "https://httpbin.org/get"</span><span class="pl-c1">}</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">If you want to avoid passing <code>--proxy-cacert</code> flag, also consider signing generated SSL certificates. Example:</p><p dir="auto">First, generate CA certificates:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="make ca-certificates"><pre><span class="pl-c1">make ca-certificates</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Then, sign SSL certificate:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="make sign-https-certificates"><pre><span class="pl-c1">make sign-https-certificates</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Now restart the server with <code>--cert-file https-signed-cert.pem</code> flag. Note that you must also trust generated <code>ca-cert.pem</code> in your system keychain.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">TLS Interception</h1><a id="user-content-tls-interception" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: TLS Interception" href="#tls-interception"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, <code>proxy.py</code> will not decrypt <code>https</code> traffic between client and server.To enable TLS interception first generate root CA certificates:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ make ca-certificates"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">make ca-certificates</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Lets also enable <code>CacheResponsePlugin</code> so that we can verify decryptedresponse from the server. Start <code>proxy.py</code> as:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ proxy \    --plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin \    --ca-key-file ca-key.pem \    --ca-cert-file ca-cert.pem \    --ca-signing-key-file ca-signing-key.pem"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">proxy \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-key-file ca-key.pem \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-cert-file ca-cert.pem \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-signing-key-file ca-signing-key.pem</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><a href="https://github.com/abhinavsingh/proxy.py#user-content-flags"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/ae622aa0292fe3312939156e3246f55b973fc4c60c0ab0baad766760a509f8fb/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f7374617469632f76313f6c6162656c3d4d61634f53266d6573736167653d6e6f746526636f6c6f723d79656c6c6f77" alt="NOTE" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=MacOS&message=note&color=yellow" style="max-width: 100%;"></a> Also provide explicit CA bundle path needed for validation of peer certificates. See <code>--ca-file</code> flag.</p><p dir="auto">Verify TLS interception using <code>curl</code></p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ curl -v -x localhost:8899 --cacert ca-cert.pem https://httpbin.org/get"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">curl -v -x localhost:8899 --cacert ca-cert.pem https://httpbin.org/get</span></pre></div><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="*  issuer: C=US; ST=CA; L=SanFrancisco; O=proxy.py; OU=CA; CN=Proxy PY CA; emailAddress=proxyca@mailserver.com*  SSL certificate verify ok.> GET /get HTTP/1.1... [redacted] ...< Connection: keep-alive<{  "args": {},  "headers": {    "Accept": "*/*",    "Host": "httpbin.org",    "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0"  },  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",  "url": "https://httpbin.org/get"}"><pre><span class="pl-c1">*  issuer: C=US; ST=CA; L=SanFrancisco; O=proxy.py; OU=CA; CN=Proxy PY CA; emailAddress=proxyca@mailserver.com</span><span class="pl-c1">*  SSL certificate verify ok.</span>> <span class="pl-s1">GET /get HTTP/1.1</span><span class="pl-c1">... [redacted] ...</span><span class="pl-c1">< Connection: keep-alive</span><span class="pl-c1"><</span><span class="pl-c1">{</span><span class="pl-c1">  "args": {},</span><span class="pl-c1">  "headers": {</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Accept": "*/*",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Host": "httpbin.org",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0"</span><span class="pl-c1">  },</span><span class="pl-c1">  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",</span><span class="pl-c1">  "url": "https://httpbin.org/get"</span><span class="pl-c1">}</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">The <code>issuer</code> line confirms that response was intercepted.</p><p dir="auto">Also verify the contents of cached response file. Get path to the cachefile from <code>proxy.py</code> logs.</p><p dir="auto"><code>❯ cat /path/to/your/tmp/directory/httpbin.org-1569452863.924174.txt</code></p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="HTTP/1.1 200 OKAccess-Control-Allow-Credentials: trueAccess-Control-Allow-Origin: *Content-Type: application/jsonDate: Wed, 25 Sep 2019 23:07:05 GMTReferrer-Policy: no-referrer-when-downgradeServer: nginxX-Content-Type-Options: nosniffX-Frame-Options: DENYX-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=blockContent-Length: 202Connection: keep-alive{  "args": {},  "headers": {    "Accept": "*/*",    "Host": "httpbin.org",    "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0"  },  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",  "url": "https://httpbin.org/get"}"><pre><span class="pl-c1">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</span><span class="pl-c1">Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true</span><span class="pl-c1">Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *</span><span class="pl-c1">Content-Type: application/json</span><span class="pl-c1">Date: Wed, 25 Sep 2019 23:07:05 GMT</span><span class="pl-c1">Referrer-Policy: no-referrer-when-downgrade</span><span class="pl-c1">Server: nginx</span><span class="pl-c1">X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff</span><span class="pl-c1">X-Frame-Options: DENY</span><span class="pl-c1">X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block</span><span class="pl-c1">Content-Length: 202</span><span class="pl-c1">Connection: keep-alive</span><span class="pl-c1">{</span><span class="pl-c1">  "args": {},</span><span class="pl-c1">  "headers": {</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Accept": "*/*",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "Host": "httpbin.org",</span><span class="pl-c1">    "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0"</span><span class="pl-c1">  },</span><span class="pl-c1">  "origin": "1.2.3.4, 5.6.7.8",</span><span class="pl-c1">  "url": "https://httpbin.org/get"</span><span class="pl-c1">}</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Viola!!! If you remove CA flags, encrypted data will be found in thecached file instead of plain text.</p><p dir="auto">Now use CA flags with other<a href="#plugin-examples">plugin examples</a> to see them work with <code>https</code> traffic.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">TLS Interception With Docker</h2><a id="user-content-tls-interception-with-docker" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: TLS Interception With Docker" href="#tls-interception-with-docker"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Important notes about TLS Interception with Docker container:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto">Since <code>v2.2.0</code>, <code>proxy.py</code> docker container also ships with <code>openssl</code>. This allows <code>proxy.py</code>to generate certificates on the fly for TLS Interception.</p></li><li><p dir="auto">For security reasons, <code>proxy.py</code> docker container does not ship withCA certificates.</p></li></ul><p dir="auto">Here is how to start a <code>proxy.py</code> docker containerwith TLS Interception:</p><ol dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto">Generate CA certificates on host computer</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ make ca-certificates"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">make ca-certificates</span></pre></div></li><li><p dir="auto">Copy all generated certificates into a separate directory. We'll later mount this directory into our docker container</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ mkdir /tmp/ca-certificates❯ cp ca-cert.pem ca-key.pem ca-signing-key.pem /tmp/ca-certificates"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">mkdir /tmp/ca-certificates</span>❯ <span class="pl-s1">cp ca-cert.pem ca-key.pem ca-signing-key.pem /tmp/ca-certificates</span></pre></div></li><li><p dir="auto">Start docker container</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ docker run -it --rm \    -v /tmp/ca-certificates:/tmp/ca-certificates \    -p 8899:8899 \    abhinavsingh/proxy.py:latest \    --hostname 0.0.0.0 \    --plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin \    --ca-key-file /tmp/ca-certificates/ca-key.pem \    --ca-cert-file /tmp/ca-certificates/ca-cert.pem \    --ca-signing-key /tmp/ca-certificates/ca-signing-key.pem"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">docker run -it --rm \</span><span class="pl-c1">    -v /tmp/ca-certificates:/tmp/ca-certificates \</span><span class="pl-c1">    -p 8899:8899 \</span><span class="pl-c1">    abhinavsingh/proxy.py:latest \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --hostname 0.0.0.0 \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-key-file /tmp/ca-certificates/ca-key.pem \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-cert-file /tmp/ca-certificates/ca-cert.pem \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --ca-signing-key /tmp/ca-certificates/ca-signing-key.pem</span></pre></div><ul dir="auto"><li><code>-v /tmp/ca-certificates:/tmp/ca-certificates</code> flag mounts our CA certificate directory in container environment</li><li><code>--plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin</code> enables <code>CacheResponsesPlugin</code> so that we can inspect intercepted traffic</li><li><code>--ca-*</code> flags enable TLS Interception.</li></ul></li><li><p dir="auto">From another terminal, try TLS Interception using <code>curl</code>. You can omit <code>--cacert</code> flag if CA certificate is already trusted by the system.</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ curl -v \    --cacert ca-cert.pem \    -x 127.0.0.1:8899 \    https://httpbin.org/get"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">curl -v \</span><span class="pl-c1">    --cacert ca-cert.pem \</span><span class="pl-c1">    -x 127.0.0.1:8899 \</span><span class="pl-c1">    https://httpbin.org/get</span></pre></div></li><li><p dir="auto">Verify <code>issuer</code> field from response headers.</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="* Server certificate:*  subject: CN=httpbin.org; C=NA; ST=Unavailable; L=Unavailable; O=Unavailable; OU=Unavailable*  start date: Jun 17 09:26:57 2020 GMT*  expire date: Jun 17 09:26:57 2022 GMT*  subjectAltName: host "httpbin.org" matched cert's "httpbin.org"*  issuer: CN=example.com*  SSL certificate verify ok."><pre><span class="pl-c1">* Server certificate:</span><span class="pl-c1">*  subject: CN=httpbin.org; C=NA; ST=Unavailable; L=Unavailable; O=Unavailable; OU=Unavailable</span><span class="pl-c1">*  start date: Jun 17 09:26:57 2020 GMT</span><span class="pl-c1">*  expire date: Jun 17 09:26:57 2022 GMT</span><span class="pl-c1">*  subjectAltName: host "httpbin.org" matched cert's "httpbin.org"</span><span class="pl-c1">*  issuer: CN=example.com</span><span class="pl-c1">*  SSL certificate verify ok.</span></pre></div></li><li><p dir="auto">Back on docker terminal, copy response dump path logs.</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="...[redacted]... [I] access_log:338 - 172.17.0.1:56498 - CONNECT httpbin.org:443 - 1031 bytes - 1216.70 ms...[redacted]... [I] close:49 - Cached response at /tmp/httpbin.org-ae1a927d064e4ab386ea319eb38fe251.txt"><pre><span class="pl-c1">...[redacted]... [I] access_log:338 - 172.17.0.1:56498 - CONNECT httpbin.org:443 - 1031 bytes - 1216.70 ms</span><span class="pl-c1">...[redacted]... [I] close:49 - Cached response at /tmp/httpbin.org-ae1a927d064e4ab386ea319eb38fe251.txt</span></pre></div></li><li><p dir="auto">In another terminal, <code>cat</code> the response dump:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ docker exec -it $(docker ps | grep proxy.py | awk '{ print $1 }') cat /tmp/httpbin.org-ae1a927d064e4ab386ea319eb38fe251.txtHTTP/1.1 200 OK...[redacted]...{  ...[redacted]...,  "url": "http://httpbin.org/get"}"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">docker <span class="pl-c1">exec</span> -it <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">$(</span>docker ps <span class="pl-k">|</span> grep proxy.py <span class="pl-k">|</span> awk <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>{ print $1 }<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-pds">)</span></span> cat /tmp/httpbin.org-ae1a927d064e4ab386ea319eb38fe251.txt</span><span class="pl-c1">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</span><span class="pl-c1">...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">{</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...,</span><span class="pl-c1">  "url": "http://httpbin.org/get"</span><span class="pl-c1">}</span></pre></div></li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Proxy Over SSH Tunnel</h1><a <code>localhost</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">How</h3><a id="user-content-how" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: How" href="#how"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 connection.</li><li><code>proxy.py</code> running on the <code>localhost</code> handles and responds to<code>remote</code> proxy requests.</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Requirements</h3><a id="user-content-requirements" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Requirements" href="#requirements"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><ol dir="auto"><li><code>localhost</code> MUST have SSH access to the <code>remote</code> server</li><li><code>remote</code> server MUST be configured to proxy HTTP(s) requeststhrough the forwarded port number e.g. <code>:8900</code>.<ul dir="auto"><li><code>remote</code> and <code>localhost</code> ports CAN be same e.g. <code>:8899</code>.</li><li><code>:8900</code> is chosen in ascii art for differentiation purposes.</li></ul></li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import proxyif __name__ == '__main__':  proxy.main()"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span><span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">__name__</span> <span class="pl-c1">==</span> <span class="pl-s">'__main__'</span>:  <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span>.<span class="pl-en">main</span>()</pre></div><p dir="auto">Customize startup flags by passing them as kwargs:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import ipaddressimport proxyif __name__ == '__main__':  proxy.main(    hostname=ipaddress.IPv6Address('::1'),    port=8899  )"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">ipaddress</span><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span><span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">__name__</span> <span class="pl-c1">==</span> <span class="pl-s">'__main__'</span>:  <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span>.<span class="pl-en">main</span>(    <span class="pl-s1">hostname</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s1">ipaddress</span>.<span class="pl-v">IPv6Address</span>(<span class="pl-s">'::1'</span>),    <span class="pl-s1">port</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">8899</span>  )</pre></div><p dir="auto">Note that:</p><ol dir="auto"><li><code>main</code> is equivalent to starting <code>proxy.py</code> from command line.</li><li><code>main</code> does not accept any <code>args</code> (only <code>kwargs</code>).</li><li><code>main</code> will automatically consume any available <code>sys.argv</code> as <code>args</code>.</li><li><code>main</code> will block until <code>proxy.py</code> shuts down.</li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Start <code>proxy.py</code> in non-blocking embedded mode with default configurationby using <code>Proxy</code> context manager: Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import proxyif __name__ == '__main__':  with proxy.Proxy() as p:    # Uncomment the line below and    # implement your app your logic here    proxy.sleep_loop()"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span><span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">__name__</span> <span class="pl-c1">==</span> <span class="pl-s">'__main__'</span>:  <span class="pl-k">with</span> <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span>.<span class="pl-v">Proxy</span>() <span class="pl-k">as</span> <span class="pl-s1">p</span>:    <span class="pl-c"># Uncomment the line below and</span>    <span class="pl-c"># implement your app your logic here</span>    <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span>.<span class="pl-en">sleep_loop</span>()</pre></div><p dir="auto">Note that:</p><ol dir="auto"><li><code>Proxy</code> is similar to <code>main</code>, except <code>Proxy</code> will not block.</li><li>Internally, <code>Proxy</code> is a context manager which will start<code>proxy.py</code> when called and will shut it down once the scope ends.</li><li>Unlike <code>main</code>, startup flags with <code>Proxy</code> can also be customizedby using <code>args</code> and <code>kwargs</code>. e.g. <code>Proxy(['--port', '8899'])</code> orby using passing flags as kwargs e.g. <code>Proxy(port=8899)</code>.</li><li>Unlike <code>main</code>, <code>Proxy</code> will not inspect <code>sys.argv</code>.</li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" proxy.Proxy() as p:    print(p.flags.port)    proxy.sleep_loop()"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span><span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">__name__</span> class="pl-s1">proxy</span>.<span class="pl-en">sleep_loop</span>()</pre></div><p dir="auto"><code>flags.port</code> will give you access to the random port allocated by the kernel.</p><div multiple plugins.See <a href="#unable-to-load-plugins">Unable to load plugins</a> if you are running into issues.</p><p dir="auto">When using in embedded mode, you have a few more options.  Example:</p><ol dir="auto"><li>Provide a fully-qualified name of the plugin class as <code>bytes</code> to the <code>proxy.main</code> method or <code>proxy.Proxy</code> context manager.</li><li>Provide <code>type</code> instance of the plugin class. This is especially useful if you plan to define plugins at runtime.</li></ol><p dir="auto">Example, load a single plugin using <code>--plugins</code> flag:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import proxyif __name__ == '__main__':  proxy.main(plugins=['proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin'])"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span><span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">__name__</span> <span class="pl-s">'proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin'</span>])</pre></div><p dir="auto">For simplicity, you can also pass the list of plugins as a keyword argument to <code>proxy.main</code> or the data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import proxyfrom proxy.plugin import FilterByUpstreamHostPluginif __name__ == '__main__':  proxy.main(plugins=[    b'proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin', class="pl-s">'__main__'</span>:  <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span>.<span class="pl-en">main</span>(<span class="pl-s1">plugins</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span>[    <span 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">To setup and tear down <code>proxy.py</code> for your Python <code>unittest</code> classes, simply use <code>proxy.TestCase</code> instead of <code>unittest.TestCase</code>.Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import proxyclass TestProxyPyEmbedded(proxy.TestCase):    def test_my_application_with_proxy(self) -> None:        self.assertTrue(True)"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">proxy</span><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">TestProxyPyEmbedded</span>(<span class="pl-s1">proxy</span>.<span class="pl-v">TestCase</span>):    <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">test_my_application_with_proxy</span>(<span class="pl-s1">self</span>) <span class="pl-c1">-></span> <span class="pl-c1">None</span>:        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">assertTrue</span>(<span class="pl-c1">True</span>)</pre></div><p dir="auto">Note that:</p><ol dir="auto"><li><code>proxy.TestCase</code> overrides <code>unittest.TestCase.run()</code> method to setup and tear down <code>proxy.py</code>.</li><li><code>proxy.py</code> server will listen on a random available port on the system.This random port is available as <code>self.PROXY.flags.port</code> within your test cases.</li><li>Only a single acceptor and worker is started by default (<code>--num-workers 1 --num-acceptors 1</code>) for faster setup and tear down.</li><li>Most importantly, <code>proxy.TestCase</code> also ensures <code>proxy.py</code> serveris up and running before proceeding with execution of tests. By default,<code>proxy.TestCase</code> will wait for <code>10 seconds</code> for <code>proxy.py</code> server to start,upon failure a <code>TimeoutError</code> exception will be raised.</li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Override startup flags</h2><a id="user-content-override-startup-flags" class="anchor-element" class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">What not to do?</h3><a id="user-content-what-not-to-do" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: What not to do?" href="#what-not-to-do"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><blockquote><p dir="auto">You MUST <code>avoid forking</code> the repository <em>"just"</em> to put your plugin code in <code>proxy/plugin</code> directory.  Forking is recommended workflow for project contributors, NOT for project users.</p></blockquote><ul dir="auto"><li>Instead, use one of the suggested approaches from below.</li><li>Then load your plugins using <code>--plugin</code>, <code>--plugins</code> flags or <code>plugin</code> kwargs.</li><li>See <a href="https://github.com/abhinavsingh/proxy.py/tree/develop/skeleton">skeleton</a> app for example standalone project using <code>proxy.py</code>.</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Via Requirements</h3><a id="user-content-via-requirements" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Via Requirements" href="#via-requirements"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">It is <em>highly</em> recommended that you use <code>proxy.py</code> via <code>requirements.txt</code> or similar dependency management setups. This will allow you to take advantages of regular performance updates, bug fixes, security patches and other improvements happening in the <code>proxy.py</code> ecosystem.  Example:</p><ol dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto">Use <code>--pre</code> option to depend upon last <code>pre-release</code></p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ pip install proxy.py --pre"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">pip install proxy.py --pre</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Pre-releases are similar to depending upon <code>develop</code> branch code, just that pre-releases may not point to the <code>HEAD</code>.  This could happen because pre-releases are NOT made available on <code>PyPi</code> after every PR merge.</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Use <code>TestPyPi</code> with <code>--pre</code> option to depend upon <code>develop</code> branch code</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ pip install -i https://test.pypi.org/simple/ proxy.py --pre"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">pip install -i https://test.pypi.org/simple/ proxy.py --pre</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">A pre-release is made available on <code>TestPyPi</code> after every PR merge.</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Use last <code>stable</code> release code</p><p dir="auto">As usual, simply use:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❯ pip install proxy.py"><pre>❯ <span class="pl-s1">pip install proxy.py</span></pre></div></li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Via Docker Container</h3><a id="user-content-via-docker-container" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Via Docker Container" href="#via-docker-container"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">If you are into deploying containers, then simply build your image from base <code>proxy.py</code> container images.</p><ol dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto">Use <code>GHCR</code> to build from <code>develop</code> branch code:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="FROM ghcr.io/abhinavsingh/proxy.py:latest as base"><pre><span class="pl-c1">FROM ghcr.io/abhinavsingh/proxy.py:latest as base</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><em>PS: I use GHCR latest for several production level projects</em></p></li><li><p dir="auto">Use <code>DockerHub</code> to build from last <code>stable</code> release code:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="FROM abhinavsingh/proxy.py:latest as base"><pre><span class="pl-c1">FROM abhinavsingh/proxy.py:latest as base</span></pre></div></li></ol><p dir="auto">PS: IMHO, container based strategy is <em>the best approach</em> and the only strategy that <em>I use myself</em>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Integrate your CI/CD with proxy.py</h3><a id="user-content-integrate-your-cicd-with-proxypy" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Integrate your CI/CD with proxy.py" href="#integrate-your-cicd-with-proxypy"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><em>Hey, but you keep making breaking changes in the develop branch.</em></p><p dir="auto">I hear you.  And hence, for your production grade applications, you <em>MUST</em> integrate application CI/CD with <code>proxy.py</code>.  You must make sure that your application builds and passes its tests for every PR merge into the <code>proxy.py</code> upstream repo.</p><p dir="auto">If your application repository is public, in certain scenarios, PR authors may send patch PRs for all dependents to maintain backward incompatibility and green CI/CD.</p><p dir="auto">CI/CD integration ensure your app continues to build with latest <code>proxy.py</code> code.  Depending upon where you host your code, use the strategy listed below:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto">GitHub</p><p dir="auto">TBD</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Google Cloud Build</p><p dir="auto">TBD</p></li><li><p dir="auto">AWS</p><p dir="auto">TBD</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Azure</p><p dir="auto">TBD</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Others</p><p dir="auto">TBD</p></li></ul><blockquote><p dir="auto">At some stage, we'll deprecate <code>master</code> branch segregation and simply maintain a <code>develop</code> branch.  As dependents can maintain stability via CI/CD integrations. Currently, it's hard for a production grade project to blindly depend upon <code>develop</code> branch.</p></blockquote><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Stable vs Develop</h2><a id="user-content-stable-vs-develop" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Stable vs Develop" href="#stable-vs-develop"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><ul dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto"><code>master</code> branch contains latest <code>stable</code> code and is available via <code>PyPi</code> repository and <code>Docker</code> containers via <code>docker.io</code> and <code>ghcr.io</code> registries.</p><p dir="auto">Issues reported for <code>stable</code> releases are considered with top-priority.  However, currently we don't back port fixes into older releases.  Example, if you reported an issue in <code>v2.3.1</code>, but current <code>master</code> branch now contains <code>v2.4.0rc1</code>.  Then, the fix will land in <code>v2.4.0rc2</code>.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>develop</code> branch contains cutting edge changes</p><p dir="auto">Development branch is kept stable <em>(most of the times)</em>. <strong>But</strong>, if you want <em>100% reliability</em> and serving users in <em>production environment</em>, ALWAYS use the stable version.</p></li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Release Schedule</h3><a id="user-content-release-schedule" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Release Schedule" href="#release-schedule"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">A <code>vX.Y.ZrcN</code> pull request is created once a month which merges <code>develop</code> → <code>master</code>.  Find below how code flows from a pull request to the next stable release.</p><ol dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto">Development release is deployed from <code>develop</code> → <code>test.pypi.org</code> after every pull request merge</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Alpha release is deployed from <code>develop</code> → <code>pypi.org</code> <strong>before</strong> merging the <code>vX.Y.Z.rcN</code> pull request from <code>develop</code> → <code>master</code> branch.  There can be multiple alpha releases made before merging the <code>rc</code> pull request</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Beta release is deployed from <code>master</code> → <code>pypi.org</code>.  Beta releases are made in preparation of <code>rc</code> releases and can be skipped if unnecessary</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Release candidate is deployed from <code>master</code> → <code>pypi.org</code>.  Release candidates are always made available before final stable release</p></li><li><p dir="auto">Stable release is deployed from <code>master</code> → <code>pypi.org</code></p></li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Threads vs Threadless</h2><a id="user-content-threads-vs-threadless" class="anchor-element" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>v2.0+</code></h3><a id="user-content-v20" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: v2.0+" href="#v20"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><code>proxy.py</code> added support for threadless execution of client requests using <code>asyncio</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>v2.4.0+</code></h3><a id="user-content-v240" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: v2.4.0+" href="#v240"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Threadless execution was turned ON by default for <code>Python 3.8+</code> on <code>mac</code> and <code>linux</code> environments.</p><p dir="auto"><code>proxy.py</code> threadless execution has been reported safe on these environments by our users. If you are running into trouble, fallback to threaded mode using <code>--threaded</code> flag.</p><p dir="auto">For <code>windows</code> and <code>Python < 3.8</code>, you can still try out threadless mode by starting <code>proxy.py</code> with <code>--threadless</code> flag.</p><p dir="auto">If threadless works for you, consider sending a PR by editing <code>_env_threadless_compliant</code> method in the <code>proxy/common/constants.py</code> file.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Threadless Remote vs Local execution mode</h2><a id="user-content-threadless-remote-vs-local-execution-mode" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Threadless Remote vs Local execution mode" href="#threadless-remote-vs-local-execution-mode"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Original threadless implementation used <code>remote</code> execution mode.  This is also depicted under <a href="#high-level-architecture">High level architecture</a> as ASCII art.</p><p dir="auto">Under <code>remote</code> execution mode, acceptors delegate incoming client connection processing to a remote worker process.  By default, acceptors delegate connections in round-robin fashion.  Worker processing the request may or may not be running on the same CPU core as the acceptor.  This architecture scales well for high throughput, but results in spawning two process per CPU core.</p><p dir="auto">Example, if there are N-CPUs on the machine, by default, N acceptors and N worker processes are started.  You can tune number of processes using <code>--num-acceptors</code> and <code>--num-workers</code> flag.  You might want more workers than acceptors or vice versa depending upon your use case.</p><p dir="auto">In v2.4.x, <code>local</code> execution mode was added, mainly to reduce number of processes spawned by default.  This model serves well for day-to-day single user use cases and for developer testing scenarios.  Under <code>local</code> execution mode, acceptors delegate client connections to a companion thread, instead of a remote process.  <code>local</code> execution mode ensure CPU affinity, unlike in the <code>remote</code> mode where acceptor and worker might be running on different CPU cores.</p><p dir="auto"><code>--local-executor 1</code> was made default in v2.4.x series.  Under <code>local</code> execution mode, <code>--num-workers</code> flag has no effect, as no remote workers are started.</p><p dir="auto">To use <code>remote</code> execution mode, use <code>--local-executor 0</code> flag.  Then use <code>--num-workers</code> to tune number of worker processes.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">SyntaxError: invalid syntax</h2><a id="user-content-syntaxerror-invalid-syntax" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: SyntaxError: invalid syntax" href="#syntaxerror-invalid-syntax"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><code>proxy.py</code> is strictly typed and uses Python <code>typing</code> annotations. Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> my_strings : List[str] = []>>> #############^^^^^^^^^#####"><pre><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-s1">my_strings</span> : <span class="pl-v">List</span>[<span class="pl-s1">str</span>] <span class="pl-c1">=</span> []<span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-c">#############^^^^^^^^^#####</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Hence a Python version that understands typing annotations is required.Make sure you are using <code>Python 3.6+</code>.</p><p dir="auto">Verify the version before running <code>proxy.py</code>:</p><p dir="auto"><code>❯ python --version</code></p><p dir="auto">All <code>typing</code> annotations can be replaced with <code>comment-only</code> annotations. Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> my_strings = [] # List[str]>>> ################^^^^^^^^^^^"><pre><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-s1">my_strings</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> [] <span class="pl-c"># List[str]</span><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-c">################^^^^^^^^^^^</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">It will enable <code>proxy.py</code> to run on Python <code>pre-3.6</code>, even on <code>2.7</code>.However, as all future versions of Python will support <code>typing</code> annotations,this has not been considered.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Unable to load plugins</h2><a id="user-content-unable-to-load-plugins" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Unable to load plugins" href="#unable-to-load-plugins"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Make sure plugin modules are discoverable by adding them to <code>PYTHONPATH</code>. Example:</p><p dir="auto"><code>PYTHONPATH=/path/to/my/app proxy --plugins my_app.proxyPlugin</code></p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="...[redacted]... - Loaded plugin proxy.HttpProxyPlugin...[redacted]... - Loaded plugin my_app.proxyPlugin"><pre><span class="pl-c1">...[redacted]... - Loaded plugin proxy.HttpProxyPlugin</span><span class="pl-c1">...[redacted]... - Loaded plugin my_app.proxyPlugin</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">OR, simply pass fully-qualified path as parameter, e.g.</p><p dir="auto"><code>proxy --plugins /path/to/my/app/my_app.proxyPlugin</code></p><p dir="auto">Here is a quick working example:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>Contents of <code>/tmp/plug</code> folder</li></ul><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="╰─ ls -1 /tmp/plug                                                                                                                       ─╯my_plugin.py"><pre><span class="pl-c1">╰─ ls -1 /tmp/plug                                                                                                                       ─╯</span><span class="pl-c1">my_plugin.py</span></pre></div><ul dir="auto"><li>Custom <code>MyPlugin</code> class</li></ul><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="╰─ cat /tmp/plug/my_plugin.py                                                                                                            ─╯from proxy.http.proxy import HttpProxyBasePluginclass MyPlugin(HttpProxyBasePlugin):  pass"><pre><span class="pl-c1">╰─ cat /tmp/plug/my_plugin.py                                                                                                            ─╯</span><span class="pl-c1">from proxy.http.proxy import HttpProxyBasePlugin</span><span class="pl-c1">class MyPlugin(HttpProxyBasePlugin):</span><span class="pl-c1">  pass</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">This is an empty plugin for demonstrating external plugin usage.
