It simply meansthat an upstream server connection was never established i.e.<code>upstream_host=None</code>, <code>upstream_port=None</code>.</p><p dir="auto">There can be several reasons for no upstream connection,few obvious ones include:</p><ol dir="auto"><li>Client established a connection but never completed the request.</li><li>A plugin returned a response prematurely, avoiding connection to upstream server.</li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">OSError when wrapping client for TLS Interception</h2><a id="user-content-oserror-when-wrapping-client-for-tls-interception" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: OSError when wrapping client for TLS Interception" href="#oserror-when-wrapping-client-for-tls-interception"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">With <code>TLS Interception</code> on, you might occasionally see following exceptions:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="2021-11-06 23:33:34,540 - pid:91032 [E] server.intercept:678 - OSError when wrapping clientTraceback (most recent call last):  ...[redacted]...  ...[redacted]...  ...[redacted]...ssl.SSLError: [SSL: TLSV1_ALERT_UNKNOWN_CA] tlsv1 alert unknown ca (_ssl.c:997)...[redacted]... - CONNECT oauth2.googleapis.com:443 - 0 bytes - 272.08 ms"><pre><span class="pl-c1">2021-11-06 23:33:34,540 - pid:91032 [E] server.intercept:678 - OSError when wrapping client</span><span class="pl-c1">Traceback (most recent call last):</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">ssl.SSLError: [SSL: TLSV1_ALERT_UNKNOWN_CA] tlsv1 alert unknown ca (_ssl.c:997)</span><span class="pl-c1">...[redacted]... - CONNECT oauth2.googleapis.com:443 - 0 bytes - 272.08 ms</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Some clients can throw <code>TLSV1_ALERT_UNKNOWN_CA</code> if they cannot verify the certificate of the serverbecause it is signed by an unknown issuer CA.  Which is the case when we are doing TLS interception.This can be for a variety of reasons e.g. certificate pinning etc.</p><p dir="auto">Another exception you might see is <code>CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="2021-11-06 23:36:02,002 - pid:91033 [E] handler.handle_readables:293 - Exception while receiving from client connection <socket.socket fd=28, family=AddressFamily.AF_INET, type=SocketKind.SOCK_STREAM, proto=0, laddr=('127.0.0.1', 8899), raddr=('127.0.0.1', 51961)> with reason SSLCertVerificationError(1, '[SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: self signed certificate in certificate chain (_ssl.c:997)')Traceback (most recent call last):  ...[redacted]...  ...[redacted]...  ...[redacted]...ssl.SSLCertVerificationError: [SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: self signed certificate in certificate chain (_ssl.c:997)...[redacted]... - CONNECT init.push.apple.com:443 - 0 bytes - 892.99 ms"><pre><span class="pl-c1">2021-11-06 23:36:02,002 - pid:91033 [E] handler.handle_readables:293 - Exception while receiving from client connection <socket.socket fd=28, family=AddressFamily.AF_INET, type=SocketKind.SOCK_STREAM, proto=0, laddr=('127.0.0.1', 8899), raddr=('127.0.0.1', 51961)> with reason SSLCertVerificationError(1, '[SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: self signed certificate in certificate chain (_ssl.c:997)')</span><span class="pl-c1">Traceback (most recent call last):</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">ssl.SSLCertVerificationError: [SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: self signed certificate in certificate chain (_ssl.c:997)</span><span class="pl-c1">...[redacted]... - CONNECT init.push.apple.com:443 - 0 bytes - 892.99 ms</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">In future, we might support serving original HTTPS content for such clients while stillperforming TLS interception in the background.  This will keep the clients happy withoutimpacting our ability to TLS intercept.  Unfortunately, this feature is currently not available.</p><p dir="auto">Another example with <code>SSLEOFError</code> exception:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate ms"><pre><span class="pl-c1">2021-11-06 23:46:40,446 - pid:91034 [E] server.intercept:678 - OSError when wrapping client</span><span class="pl-c1">Traceback (most recent call last):</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">  ...[redacted]...</span><span class="pl-c1">ssl.SSLEOFError: EOF occurred in violation of class="pl-c1">         +------++------++------++------++------+</span><span class="pl-c1">                Threadless Worker Processes</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><code>proxy.py</code> is made with performance in mind.  By default, <code>proxy.py</code>will try to utilize all available CPU cores to it for accepting newclient connections. This is achieved by starting <code>AcceptorPool</code> whichlistens on configured server port. Then, <code>AcceptorPool</code> starts <code>Acceptor</code>processes (<code>--num-acceptors</code>) to accept incoming client connections.Alongside, if <code>--threadless</code> is enabled, <code>ThreadlessPool</code> is setupwhich starts <code>Threadless</code> processes (<code>--num-workers</code>) to handlethe incoming client connections.</p><p dir="auto">Each <code>Acceptor</code> process delegates the accepted client connectionto a threadless process via <code>Work</code> class.  Currently, <code>HttpProtocolHandler</code>is the default work class.</p><p dir="auto"><code>HttpProtocolHandler</code> simply assumes that incoming clients will followHTTP specification.  Specific HTTP proxy and HTTP server implementationsare written as plugins of <code>HttpProtocolHandler</code>.</p><p dir="auto">See documentation of <code>HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin</code> for available lifecycle hooks.Use <code>HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin</code> to add new features for http(s) clients. Example,See <code>HttpWebServerPlugin</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Everything is a plugin</h2><a id="user-content-everything-is-a-plugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Everything is a plugin" href="#everything-is-a-plugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Within <code>proxy.py</code> everything is a plugin.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto">We enabled <code>proxy server</code> plugins using <code>--plugins</code> flag.Proxy server <code>HttpProxyPlugin</code> is a plugin of <code>HttpProtocolHandler</code>.Further, Proxy server allows plugin through <code>HttpProxyBasePlugin</code> specification.</p></li><li><p dir="auto">All the proxy server <a href="#plugin-examples">plugin examples</a> were implementing<code>HttpProxyBasePlugin</code>. See documentation of <code>HttpProxyBasePlugin</code> for availablelifecycle hooks. Use <code>HttpProxyBasePlugin</code> to modify behavior of http(s) proxy protocolbetween client and upstream server. Example,<a href="#filterbyupstreamhostplugin">FilterByUpstreamHostPlugin</a>.</p></li><li><p dir="auto">We also enabled inbuilt <code>web server</code> using <code>--enable-web-server</code>.Web server <code>HttpWebServerPlugin</code> is a plugin of <code>HttpProtocolHandler</code>and implements <code>HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin</code> specification.</p></li><li><p dir="auto">There also is a <code>--disable-http-proxy</code> flag. It disables inbuilt proxy server.Use this flag with <code>--enable-web-server</code> flag to run <code>proxy.py</code> as a programmablehttp(s) server.</p></li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Managing states for your stateless plugins</h2><a id="user-content-managing-states-for-your-stateless-plugins" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Managing states for your stateless plugins" href="#managing-states-for-your-stateless-plugins"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Plugin class instances are created per-request.  Most importantly,plugin instances are created within CPU core context where the requestwas received.</p><p dir="auto">For above reason, global variables in your plugins may work as expected.Your plugin code by design must be <strong>stateless</strong>.</p><p dir="auto">To manage global states, you have a couple of options:</p><ol dir="auto"><li>Make use of Python's <a href="https://python.readthedocs.io/en/latest/library/multiprocessing.html#sharing-state-between-processes" rel="nofollow">multiprocessing safe data structures</a></li><li>Make use of <code>proxy.py</code> in-built <a href="https://github.com/abhinavsingh/proxy.py/blob/develop/tutorial/eventing.ipynb">eventing mechanism</a></li></ol><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Passing processing context between plugins</h2><a id="user-content-passing-processing-context-between-plugins" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Passing processing context between plugins" href="#passing-processing-context-between-plugins"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Sometimes, a plugin may need to pass additional context to other plugins after them in the processing chain.  Example, this additionalcontext can also be dumped as part of access logs.</p><p dir="auto">To pass processing context, make use of plugin's <code>on_access_log</code> method.  See how <a href="https://github.com/abhinavsingh/proxy.py/blob/develop/proxy/plugin/program_name.py">Program Name</a> plugin modifies default <code>client_ip</code> key in the context and updates it to detected program name.</p><p dir="auto">As a result, when we enable <a href="#programnameplugin">Program Name Plugin</a>, we see local client program name instead of IP address in the access logs.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Development Guide</h2><a id="user-content-development-guide" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Development Guide" href="#development-guide"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 href="https://github.com/abhinavsingh/proxy.py/issues/642#issuecomment-960819271" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/abhinavsingh/proxy.py/issues/642/hovercard"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/63fce45edbcc7c145987697c4927283e43e91351c4059207b87668bfc62658a5/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f7374617469632f76313f6c6162656c3d4d61634f53266d6573736167653d7761726e696e6726636f6c6f723d726564"
